system.description:
When you take this archetype at 1st level, your knowledge of necromantic magics far exceeds most, and your prolonged presence around said magic has had a profound effect on you. You gain proficiency in religion, as well as the undead speacialty.

Furthermore, whenever you use your Eldritch Blast feature, you may choose to deal necrotic damage instead of force damage.

You also choose one of the following:

Deathly Curse

You can use a bonus action to place a curse on a creature you can see within 30ft. The curse lasts 1 minute, ending early if the creature dies, you die, or you become incapacitated.

When you deal damage against the cursed creature, it takes an additional 1 d4 necrotic damage. This bonus increases by 1d4 at 10th level, and again at 15th and 10th level.

You gain a pool of necrosis dice, which begins empty. When the cursed creature fails a saving throw, add one necrosis die to this pool. You can spend a necrosis die whenever you deal damage with your Eldritch Blast, or a spell of 1st level or higher that deals necrotic damage, to deal an additional 1d4 necrotic damage. The pool disappears when you finish a short or long rest.

Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Undead Resilience

You gain resistance to necrotic and poison damage, as well as an expertise die on saving throws against poison.
